data.title: The Wanderer by Fritz Leiber, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Wanderer ( Ballantine # U6010 ). by Leiber, Fritz. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: GOOD+. Painted Front Cover. (illustrator). First Edition By This Publisher. 318 pages. "Then suddenly one day, it was there. It came without malice, an elemental force, a climactic power greater than any the Earth had ever seen in its billions of years of evolution, a phenomenon which reduced this planet to the size of an anthill pushed out of the way by a bulldozer. Men called it the Wanderer. " >>Cover creasing; spine slant; staining along right edge of book; Cover scuffing. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" Tall. Book.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good -. Artifact Painted Cover. (illustrator). First Edition By This Publisher. 318 pages. "Then suddenly one day, it was there. It came without malice, an elemental force, a climactic power greater than any the Earth had ever seen in its billions of years of evolution, a phenomenon which reduced this planet to the size of an anthill pushed out of the way by a bulldozer. Men called it the Wanderer. " >>Cover creasing; Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" Tall. Book.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good Indeed. None (illustrator). First edition. A first edition presentation copy of this science fiction novel by Fritz Leiber. The first edition.Presentation copy with inscription by the author to the title: "To 'Bill Martlock" with best wishes, Fritz Leiber".Winner of the Hugo Award for Best Novel.This science fiction novel was written by American author Fritz Leiber. This work tells the story of a wandering Planet that enters earths solar system, causing disruption and chaos.Publisher's advertisements to the rear. In the publisher's original paperback. Externally, very smart with only slight rubbing to the extremities and slight marks to the rear. Internally firmly bound with age toned pages. Very Good Indeed. signed by author. book.

Hardcover. SF novel, first published as a Ballantine paperback original in 1964: winner of the 1965 Hugo award for best novel. In Pringle, Science Fiction: The 100 Best Novels no 45. . Note: with the 1st state dustjacket WITHOUT the gold SEACON '79 stamp embossed on the front panel. All of the publisher's remaining stock of this title were stamped in this way to mark the author's appearance as Guest of Honour at the 1979 World SF Convention held in Brighton (Seacon 79), intended to be a signed and numbered edition (though in fact, this never happened). This is one of the pre-Convention copies with the original unstamped dustjacket. Light spotting along page edges, small bookstore label affixed at bottom corner of front pastedown (hidden by front flap), otherwise a fine copy in a good dustjacket with edge wear, a little background spine fade, and a small chip (1cm x 3cm max) at the top edge of rear flap fold., and dust-soiling to rear (white) panel. First hardcover edition (& 1st printing).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. Richard Weaver -- Dustwrapper (illustrator). First Edition. 450 g; II, 350 pages, last four pages blank, original dust jacket. The top edge of the text block is foxed with some spotting on the front edge block internally the pages are free of blemish, Ownership rubberstamped name at the top of front end page of a member of Melbourne's old fart fandom. Price clipped dust jacket, has a 0.5 inch tear at the bottom left-hand corner of the front panel, slight rubbing to the base edge of the jacket, and chipping to the top edge of the rear panel, with a trace of foxing to the rear fold over crease, and top left-hand corner of the rear panel. A to detail list damage. The dust jacket has been mis--creased at the time of publication, with a shift of the text on the rear panel by approximately 1 cm to the left, leaving the author's names of other works published by the publisher, with their first letter on the fold. " The Wanderer is a long disaster novel telling of the havoc caused by the arrival of a strange planet in the solar system. Its mosaic narrative technique, through which events are observed through a multiplicity of viewpoints, foreshadowed the profusion of such novels and films in the 1970s." -- the Encyclopaedia of Science Fiction. . Size: 8vo - over 7Â¾" - 9Â¾" tall. Please refer to accompanying picture (s). Illustrator: Richard Weaver -- Dustwrapper. Quantity Available: 1. Shipped Weight: Under 1 kilo. Category: Science Fiction & Fantasy; Science Fiction & Fantasy; Inventory No: 0217693.

Soft cover. Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. SIGNED FIRST EDITION FIRST PRINTING.Shelf 1001 Bright clean and tight; first paperback ( no hardbound edition at that time ); # U 6010; SIGNED "Fritz Leiber" at my request at Worldcon; Hugo winner for best novel in 1964; original 75 cent price; paper very lightly browned; a bit of very light curling at cover corners; areas of light rubbing to surface, edges and corners of covers; Not a book club (BC)copy. No previous owner name, not ex library, not a remainder. Signed by Author(s).
